result.execSummary:
The defendant Francis Steven Bucsko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Francis Steven Bucsko is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Francis Steven Bucsko was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: RMW , REP: Drost, CLERK: Minot. DA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Francis Steven Bucsko appeared from jail. Case called at 3:22 pm. Court reviews file. DA Nieskes recites agreement. No objection from Atty Petros. Court amends Count #6 w/o repeater enhancer.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to amended Count #6. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Count #6. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Counts #7 - #10. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
- 360 Days Jail. Concurrent to Barron County #16CF87
- Court Costs $268.00
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
To be converted to a Civil Judgment.
Credit for 34 Days. 
Court quashes warrant. km

State does not object. Court will set for a plea hearing tomorrow.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2018 at 03:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Francis Steven Bucsko
Current: 488 Minneapolis Avenue, Amery, WI 54001 United States  (Effective: 11-30-2015)
Prior: 480 Minneapolis Avenue, Amery, WI 54001 United States
Filed by Atty Kemp. Requesting bond modification. km
Review hearing at 02-12-2016 03:30 pm

***AMENDED***

- Bond is to be Co-Signed by Dale Bucsko

- Defendant is to be released to brother Dale Buscko's custody for transport directly to Regions Hospital Emergency Room and to a treatment facility as directed by treating physician

- If discharged or does not complete the program, defendant must report back to jail immediately

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Danielle Albert.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

 Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Adjourned 11:09 am  Review hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp   DF:  Francis Steven Bucsko appeared from jail. Case called at 3:21 p.m. Defendant has a copy of the information. Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. NG plea to all counts. Atty Kemp filed a motion to modify bond. Makes statement. Has a call into the Arbor House if they have a bed available and defendant's brother is present for transport. ADA Minser has no objection. Should have same cash bond if bed is not available. Court will conditionally grant the motion to amend bond to a $5,000 co-signature bond with brother Dale Bucsko. Court will not approve until receives a confirmation from the Arbor Place that there is a bed available and then upon the courts directive if bond will be amended or not.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 04:15 pm.
and Motion to Modify Bond. Filed by Atty Kemp. km

Arraignment at 12-29-2015 03:15 pm

Court Commissioner Heckmann for RMW, Clerk: Warrick, Rpr: Digital recorder, ADA: Matthew Hartung for ADA Minser, DF ATTY: John Kucinski and DF: Francis Steven Bucsko appeared from jail.  Case called at 2:45 pm.  Rights reserved.  S/T Deputy Thomas Williams. Direct by ADA Hartung. Defendant identified. Cross by Atty Kucinski. Re-direct by ADA Hartung. Cross by Atty Kucinski.  Witness excused. ADA Hartung asks that the court take judicial notice of the Polk Co. case 15CF114.  ADA requests bind over. Atty Kucinski objects. Court finds probable cause and binds def over for trial. Atty Kucinski requests cash bond be reduced to $200.00. ADA Hartung objects.  Bond continues in form and amount. Def stated he thought his bond was $500 not $2500. Adjourned at 3:13 pm. mw  Arraignment scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
signed by RMW 11/28/15. eif
Preliminary hearing at 12-04-2015 02:00 pm
